content.description:
An aqueous solution of potassium iodide is electrolyzed using the setup shown.

Bubbles appear on the cathode, and a yellow color appears in the solution surrounding the anode. When phenolphthalein (<math alttext="p K sub a equals 9.4" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>p</mtext> <msub> <mrow> <mi>K</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> </mrow> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>9.4</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>) is added, the solution surrounding the cathode turns pink. Standard reduction potentials are given in the table.

Half-Reaction
 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>E</mi><mo>°</mo></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahGart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGfbGaeyiSaa laaa@3BB4@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

<math alttext="K with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus 1 electron, produce K solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>K</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 2.92 Volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2.92</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H 2 O liquid plus 2 electrons produce H 2 gas plus 2 O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 0.83 Volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.83</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="O 2 gas plus 2 H 2 O liquid plus 4 electrons produce 4 O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.40 Volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.40</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="I 2 aqueous plus 2 electrons produce 2 I with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.54 Volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.54</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="O 2 gas plus 4 H with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus 4 electrons produce 2 H 2 O liquid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="1.23 Volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.23</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Which of the following identifies what is produced at the cathode and provides correct reasoning?

choices.label: <math alttext="K solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is produced; the phenolphthalein indicates that the solution is acidic, and alkali metals produce <math alttext="H 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and acidic solutions when added to water.

<math alttext="H 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are produced; gas bubbles form, and the phenolphthalein color change indicates that <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is produced in the solution around the cathode.

<math alttext="O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are produced; gas bubbles form, and the phenolphthalein color change indicates that <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is produced in the solution around the cathode.

<math alttext="O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is produced; the last half-reaction in the table has the most positive reduction potential, which indicates that it is the most favored reaction.

content.answer: <math alttext="H 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are produced; gas bubbles form, and the phenolphthalein color change indicates that <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is produced in the solution around the cathode.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
